title: N8n marketing automation workflow
summary:
I need an expert-level n8n automation engineer to build a complete lead generation intelligence pipeline within 7 days.

This workflow will:

- Acquire business data (will describe more in conversation)
- Enrich each business using Clay‚Äôs API
- Pull SEO & competitor data using DataForSEO
- Perform website audits + keyword gap + competitor analysis
- Generate a branded marketing PDF report
- Automatically save/send the reports
- This must be a production-ready pipeline, not a proof of concept.

Only apply if you have extensive experience in n8n, automation, API integrations, and fast delivery.

üìå Requirements ‚Äî MUST BE DONE IN 7 DAYS

To meet the deadline, this requires someone who:
Has already built multi-API enrichment workflows
Has used Apify ‚Üí n8n integrations
Has worked with DataForSEO APIs (or similar SEO APIs)
Is strong in data transformation
Can build PDF reports programmatically
Can produce clean, modular automations
Is available for daily check-ins

If you‚Äôve never built a similar automation pipeline before, please do not apply.

Pipeline Breakdown
1. Data Collection
Deliver structured dataset into n8n

2. Enrichment (Clay API)
Email discovery
Social profiles
Tech stack
Company firmographics
LinkedIn / people data

3. SEO & Competitor Data (DataForSEO)
Keyword visibility
Competitor domains
Keyword gap analysis
SERP position tracking
Backlink and traffic data

4. Website Analysis
Using APIs such as:
Google PageSpeed Insights
BuiltWith / Wappalyzer
Lighthouse API

5. Competitor Analysis
Automatically identify 3‚Äì10 competitors:
Ranking comparison
Keyword overlaps
PPC presence
Opportunity scoring

6. Additional Commercial Insights
(Optional‚Äîbut preferred if time allows)
Google Reviews / reputation
Social presence
Local SEO checks

7. Report Generation
Branded PDF (preferred)
Consolidate all data
Use charts, tables, and summaries
Upload to Google Drive or S3
(Optional) Auto-email the report

üß© Deliverables (All Required in 1 Week)

Fully built & tested n8n workflow
Clean modular nodes and sub-workflows

API integrations set up for:
Apify
Clay
DataForSEO
Website audit APIs
Complete report template + automated output
Example reports for at least 3 sample businesses
Documentation + short handoff call

‚è± Timeline
Day 1: Architecture + Apify + Clay integration
Day 2: DataForSEO integration
Day 3: Website audit modules
Day 4: Competitor + keyword gap logic
Day 5: PDF report generation
Day 6: Testing + refinement
Day 7: Final QA + deployment + handoff

üìù To Apply, Please Answer:

Have you built a similar multi-API n8n pipeline? Examples?

Do you have experience with Apify, Clay, and DataForSEO specifically?

What PDF generation tools do you use?

Can you commit full-time to complete this in 7 days?

What is your fixed price for this project?
bid_range: Upgrade your membership to see the bid range
feedback_received_From_Freelancer: Great client, I highly recommend. Clear communication with reasonable deadlines

John is a hard worker, so there were times when replies were slightly delayed. However, she always responded when I sent a reminder message. Overall, she was very quick to respond, and communication was smooth even with the time difference.

Hello, I am formally disputing this refund request. I worked on this project for an entire week and completed all the work as agreed ‚Äî delivering 2,000 items with full dedication and attention to detail. After I submitted the final delivery, the client removed my access to the shared Google Drive and then requested a refund. This shows clear bad faith and dishonest behavior. I have screenshots to prove that I delivered the work, sent multiple unanswered messages, and that my access was removed right after the delivery. I kindly ask that the $15.00 be released to me as fair payment for the work I honestly completed. I committed my time and energy to this project in good faith. Thank you for reviewing my case and supporting fair treatment for freelancers.
Don‚Äôt cooperate with him! He wants free service and believe in nobody.

He is like a blessing anyone can ever wish for working with (: The most amazing experience on Upwork to date. Look forward working on many more together.

title: Generate Arabic Sentences Using App
summary:
I have an app which has 2000 Arabic vocabulary words and the English translation of those words.
I have created a page within the app that allows someone to create a sentence and an English translation of that sentence for each word.

I need someone to use this application in order to create a sentence for each word.

I have included a screenshot of the app below.

There are two buttons:
- Regenerate
- Accept

The regenerate button will provide you with a new sentence idea.¬†¬†If that sentence idea is acceptable in both Arabic and English version, you can accept it.¬†¬†If not, you can regenerate.¬†¬†However, there is also an 'edit' button which will allow you to edit the sentences if the sentence is mainly acceptable, but requires some small changes.

If you click Accept, you are saying that the Arabic word, the English word, the Arabic sentence and the English translation all are good.

Once you click one of the buttons, it will go to the next item in the list.

There is also an 'undo' button which allows you to go back and change the previous items again.

title: Single Page Marketing Site Design
summary:
Overview: We are looking for a talented Web Designer and Copywriter to design and create the marketing website for our innovative prototype creation platform. Our product helps startup founders go from concept to investor-ready prototype with a range of flexible, tiered offerings‚Äîfrom static Figma designs to fully custom app prototypes. We need someone who can deliver both visually stunning designs and persuasive, clear copy to engage our target audience of non-technical founders.

Responsibilities:

Web Design:

Create a modern, professional, and user-friendly one-page marketing website in Figma (or equivalent design tool).

Design engaging visuals, icons, and mockups that communicate the value of each service tier.

Help define the visual style for the site.

Provide high-quality, responsive web designs optimized for both desktop and mobile.

Copywriting:

Write compelling, clear, and concise copy that communicates our value propositions, including the 4 service tiers.

1. Headline and Subheadline
Guidance:

The headline should grab attention and immediately communicate the primary benefit of your service in a succinct, powerful way.

The subheadline should expand on the headline, giving a brief but compelling explanation of the value you provide.

Example Headline:
"From Idea to Investor-Ready Prototype in Days."

Example Subheadline:
"Launch a polished, functional app or clickable prototype quickly‚Äîwithout the need for a dev team. Tailored solutions for startup founders, designed to impress investors and users alike."

2. Who This Is For (Target Audience)
Guidance:

Be specific about who your services are for: focus on founders, entrepreneurs, and startup teams who need fast, efficient solutions to bring their ideas to life.

Use language that resonates with them, speaking to their pain points (time, cost, skill gap) and their ambitions (getting funding, launching their app, creating a prototype to test ideas).

Example Copy:
"Our services are tailored for startup founders, indie hackers, and early-stage entrepreneurs. Whether you need a simple design, an interactive prototype to present to investors, or a fully functional MVP, we‚Äôre here to help. No technical team? No problem‚Äîour solutions are designed to help you validate your idea, gain investor interest, and test your app quickly."

3. Service Descriptions (Clearly Outlining the Four Prototype Tiers)
Guidance:

Clearly explain each tier's offerings and how they fit into the overall process of creating an app prototype.

Use simple language and focus on the benefit of each tier‚Äîwhat problems does it solve and who is it ideal for?

Include an easy-to-understand visual layout (e.g., grid or step layout) to show the progression from design-only to fully custom prototypes.

Example Copy for Tier 1 - Static Figma Mockup:
"Get a clear visual representation of your idea with a static Figma design. This tier includes one fully-designed page layout, optimized for both desktop and mobile. Perfect for founders looking to showcase their app concept or use it as a foundation for further development."

Example Copy for Tier 2 - Clickable Prototype:
"Move from static design to an interactive prototype with clickable user flows. This tier allows potential users and investors to experience your app's UX firsthand. Ideal for validating your app's usability and demonstrating functionality."

Example Copy for Tier 3 - No-Code App Prototype:
"Turn your design into a functional app prototype using pre-built components. This semi-functional MVP allows you to test and demo your app's core features without writing code, making it perfect for testing ideas and getting early feedback from users."

Example Copy for Tier 4 - Fully Custom Prototype:
"Get a fully interactive, custom-built app prototype with complex logic, integrations, and animations. Perfect for startups ready to validate a sophisticated MVP or present to investors with a polished, functional app demo."

4. Testimonials or Use Cases (Either Provided or Created)
Guidance:

If you have any existing testimonials, showcase them prominently. If not, create hypothetical use cases to demonstrate how your services have impacted clients in real-world situations.

The key is to show how your service solves a problem and creates tangible results for the user. Make it relatable and specific.

Example Testimonial:
"'I launched my MVP in just two weeks using the No-Code App Prototype. We were able to test our idea with real users and secure our first round of funding‚Äîcouldn't have done it without the team!' ‚Äî John D., Founder of FitStart"

Example Use Case:
"A founder needed an investor-ready prototype but didn‚Äôt have the technical expertise. After choosing Tier 3, they received a fully functional MVP that helped secure a $500K seed investment in just three weeks."

5. Calls to Action (Encouraging Potential Customers to Book Discovery Calls or Get Started)
Guidance:

Calls to Action (CTAs) should be compelling and clear, offering the user a straightforward next step.

Use strong action verbs and create a sense of urgency (but not pressure).

Each section should have a CTA, and the main CTA at the end should encourage them to book a discovery call or get started.

Example CTAs:

"Get Started Now"

"Book Your Free Prototype Discovery Call"

"Start with a Static Design Today"

"Need a Custom Prototype? Let's Talk!"

Placement Tips:

Place CTAs after each section where the user may feel ready to take action (e.g., after explaining each tier or after testimonials).

Use buttons that stand out visually but don't overwhelm the page. Keep them concise and action-oriented.

Ensure the copy is persuasive, highlights the benefits, and drives conversions.

These are the tiers of offerings the company offers:

Tier 1 - Static Figma Mockup
Description:
This is the simplest and most affordable option, ideal for visualizing your app idea with a static design. The mockup is created in Figma (or a similar design tool), allowing you to see your idea come to life in a visual form. It's not interactive‚Äîmore of a "first draft" in terms of layout and user experience.

Target Audience:

Entrepreneurs who are at the very beginning of their product journey.

Those who need a visual representation to share with potential co-founders or investors.

Ideal for a pitch presentation where you only need to showcase the overall concept.

Features:

One static page design (desktop and mobile).

Focus on layout, branding, and the core visual aspects of your app.

A high-quality screenshot or export to use in pitch decks or marketing materials.

What You Get:

A visual mockup to showcase your idea.

Perfect for visualizing your app without the need for complex functionality.

A great first step before deciding on more advanced prototypes.

Tier 2 - Clickable Prototype
Description:
This tier takes the visual mockup from Tier 1 and makes it interactive. The clickable prototype simulates the flow of the app, allowing users to click through screens, but it won‚Äôt have functional features. It‚Äôs ideal for showing how the app will work from a user experience (UX) perspective.

Target Audience:

Founders looking to test app usability before full development.

Entrepreneurs who want to gather feedback from potential users or investors.

Ideal for presenting to stakeholders or running user tests.

Features:

Interactive flow with clickable buttons and navigation between screens.

Basic transitions to simulate app flow.

Great for demonstrating how the app works (without coding).

What You Get:

An interactive prototype that simulates the app‚Äôs user experience.

Perfect for showcasing your app‚Äôs functionality to investors, users, and teams.

Allows for feedback on usability before building a full product.

Tier 3 - No-Code App Prototype
Description:
A step up from the clickable prototype, this tier gives you a functional MVP (minimum viable product) using no-code tools. The app has real, functioning features that can be interacted with, tested, and demonstrated as a near-real app, though without custom development.

Target Audience:

Startups with limited budgets but a need for a working prototype.

Entrepreneurs who want to test their idea in the market and gather data on user interactions.

Ideal for a test launch or a soft opening.

Features:

Fully interactive, functional prototype using no-code tools.

Real interactions like sign-up forms, data inputs, and basic logic (e.g., navigation, simple user flows).

Great for testing core features and gathering early feedback.

What You Get:

A working prototype that closely mimics a fully functional app.

Perfect for demonstrating how your product works to potential customers and investors.

A practical tool for gathering real-world feedback.

Tier 4 - Fully Custom Prototype
Description:
This is the most advanced tier, where your app prototype is custom-built with code. It‚Äôs fully interactive and includes more complex features, animations, and integrations. This prototype simulates the final product as closely as possible, making it ideal for a final-stage MVP before full-scale development.

Target Audience:

Founders who need a high-fidelity prototype for investor presentations or user testing.

Those who want to closely simulate the final product‚Äôs functionality, including complex features and integrations.

Ideal for companies who are close to launching or need to validate specific features.

Features:

Custom-built prototype with animations, integrations, and complex features (e.g., user authentication, API calls).

High-fidelity design with polished UI/UX.

Simulates the final app experience closely, including working logic and features.

What You Get:

A high-fidelity, fully interactive app prototype.

Closely mimics the final product, allowing for in-depth user testing.

Ideal for attracting investors or building excitement for your product.

Summary of Tiers:

Tier Core Features Ideal For
Tier 1: Static Figma Mockup Visual design (no interactivity) Early-stage founders, pitch presentations
Tier 2: Clickable Prototype Interactive flow, clickable screens Testing usability, gathering early feedback
Tier 3: No-Code App Prototype Real, interactive features with no-code tools User testing, MVP launches, market testing
Tier 4: Fully Custom Prototype Custom code, complex features, high-fidelity Investor demos, final-stage product testing

Collaboration:

Work closely with the development team to ensure the website is designed for smooth user experience and easy implementation.

Present and revise design and copy drafts based on feedback from stakeholders.

Requirements:

Proven experience designing marketing websites with a focus on conversion.

Strong portfolio showcasing web design skills, particularly in creating user-friendly and visually appealing websites.

Proven experience in writing persuasive copy for web marketing, with a focus on conversion optimization.

Ability to create designs in Figma.

Experience working with startup companies or understanding the startup ecosystem is a plus.

Deliverables:

Final Figma design files with complete layouts for desktop and mobile versions.

Full copy for each section of the website.

Preferred Skills:

Familiarity with UX/UI best practices.

Ability to work independently and meet deadlines.

Timeline:

We are on a very tight timeline and need someone who can put this together within 3 days.¬†¬†It is a challenge, but the right candidate can do it!

title: Generate Hindi Sentences Using App
summary:
Hi,

I‚Äôm working on an app that contains 2,000 Hindi vocabulary words paired with their English translations. I‚Äôve built a feature within the app that allows a contributor to create natural example sentences in Hindi, along with accurate English translations, for each vocabulary item.

The task involves reviewing and approving sentence suggestions using a simple interface. For each vocabulary word, the app presents a sentence idea in both Hindi and English. You‚Äôll see two buttons:

Regenerate ‚Äì generates a new sentence idea

Accept ‚Äì confirms that the current sentence pair is natural, accurate, and aligned with the vocabulary word

There‚Äôs also an Edit option in case the sentence is mostly good but needs minor tweaks, and an Undo button if you want to revisit a previous item.

The project will be divided into three milestones:

Curating the word list (spreadsheet) ‚Äì Review and finalize the list of words before sentence generation begins

First half of sentence approvals (using the app) ‚Äì Work through the first 1,000 words

Second half of sentence approvals (using the app) ‚Äì Complete the remaining 1,000 words

I‚Äôve included a screenshot of the app below so you can get a sense of the interface.

Let me know if you have any questions or need additional context. Thanks again for your interest!

title: Edit French Sentences Using App
summary:
I have an app which has 2000 French vocabulary words and the English translation of those words.
I have created a page within the app that allows someone to edit the sentences which are in the system.

I need someone to use this application in order to check each sentence and see if it acceptable.

I have included a screenshot of the app below.

There are two buttons:
- Reject
- Accept

Clicking the reject button indicates that the sentence is not acceptable.¬†¬†If the sentence is close, only off by a formatting issue or if you have a good idea for an alternative, you can click the 'edit' button instead and it will allow you to change the sentence.¬†¬†After you change the sentence, you can click 'Accept' and it will accept it.¬†¬†If the sentence is good, you can click Accept.¬†¬†Clicking the Accept button will indicate that the sentence is good.

If you click Accept, you are saying that the French word, the English word, the French sentence and the English translation all are good.

Once you click one of the buttons, it will go to the next item in the list.

There is also an 'undo' button which allows you to go back and change the previous items again.

title: Create Ansible Role to Spin Up Lightsail Instance and Setup Matomo
summary:
I am looking for someone to create roles and tasks to:
- Create a lightsail instance with a predefined keypair
¬†¬†- It should be able to receive configuration for region, ssh_key_name, etc
¬†¬†- It can assume that the default AWS environment will be configured on the ansible instance
- Create a role that will be run on the lightsail instance that was created which will:
¬†¬†- Provision the instance with the requirements for Matomo
¬†¬†- Install and configure Matomo

title: Write Ansible Script to Setup Jitsi Instance
summary: I need to get an ansible script created that will setup and provision a Jitsi server using AWS.¬†¬†I have an existing ansible project that I can add the developer to as a contributor.¬†¬†I have created an additional playbook called setup_jitsi_server and I would like someone to create the ansible config.

title: Generate Spanish Sentences Using App
summary:
I have an application that I will invite you to which presents you with a word in Spanish as well as the translation of that word in English.¬†¬†It will also present you with a sentence in Spanish and the translation of that sentence in English.

Your task is to determine whether the sentence is a good sentence for language learning material.¬†¬†You need to make sure that both sentences sound natural.¬†¬†You need to be fluent in both Spanish and English in order to do this.

If you feel that the sentence is a good sentence, you will click the 'Accept' button, and the app will go to the nexts word.¬†¬†If you feel that the sentence is not a good sentence, you will click the 'Reject' button and it will present you with a new sentence for that word.¬†¬†You will then assess the new sentence and continue this until you have found a good sentence.

There is a flat rate of $100, however, I will also be getting someone else to go behind you and edit your choices as well.¬†¬†Based upon what percentage of the 2000 sentences that you choose are flagged by the editor as not ok, you will get a bonus.¬†¬†The more sentences that the editor accepts, the higher the bonus will be.¬†¬†So there will be a potential $100 bonus based on performance based upon the number of sentences that are flagged and rejected by the editor.

Thank you for your interest in this role.

title: Redesign Language Learning App
summary:
We are seeking a talented designer to revamp our existing language learning web app. The app has most of its pages built, but we are looking for a fresh redesign to enhance user experience and engagement.¬†¬†We need a marketing (landing) page and the dashboard of the app designed from scratch. The ideal candidate should have a strong portfolio showcasing previous web app designs. You will work closely with our development team to implement the new design and ensure a seamless transition. If you're passionate about UI/UX and have a keen eye for detail, we want to hear from you!

I have a pdf of screens which I will share privately for candidates who meet our requirements.

title: Create Vietnamese and English Subtitle Files For 3 Minute Video Clip
summary: I would like to has a Vietnamese and English subtitle file created for the provided video clip.¬†¬†I would like for the subtitle files to be in either .ass or .srt format.
